Package main

Class ClackClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.ClackClient
  • public class ClackClient
extends java.lang.Object
    The Client version of the Clack program
    Author:
    Jonathan Nordby
    Stephen Miner

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ClackClient()
      Creates a ClackClient with a default port of 7000 and the default hostname is localhost (127.0.0.1) and a default username of anonymous.
      ClackClient​(java.lang.String userName)
      Creates a ClackClient with a default port of 7000 and the default hostname is localhost (127.0.0.1)
      ClackClient​(java.lang.String userName, java.lang.String hostName)
      Creates a ClackClient with a default port of 7000
      ClackClient​(java.lang.String userName, java.lang.String hostName, int port)
      Creates a ClackClient

                   java.lang.String hostName)
        Creates a ClackClient with a default port of 7000

        userName - the desired username
        hostName - the hostname of the server to connect to

      • ClackClient

        public ClackClient()
        Creates a ClackClient with a default port of 7000 and the default hostname is localhost (127.0.0.1) and a default username of anonymous.

      • ClackClient

        public ClackClient​(java.lang.String userName,
                   java.lang.String hostName,
                   int port)
        Creates a ClackClient
        Parameters:
        userName - the desired username
        hostName - the hostname of the server to connect to
        port - the port number to use
